meanings.definition: The quality or state of being awkward or clumsy in movement or appearance.
meanings.sent1: Her ungainliness was evident as she tripped over her own feet.
meanings.sent2: The dancer's ungainliness was noticeable as she struggled to perform the routine.
meanings.sent3: Despite her ungainliness, she always managed to make people laugh with her silly dance moves.
meanings.sent4: His ungainliness on the dance floor was like a baby giraffe learning to walk.
meanings.sent5: The ungainliness of the giant robot made it seem more endearing than intimidating.

meanings.definition: Lack of grace or elegance in physical movement or posture.
meanings.sent1: The gymnast's ungainliness during the routine cost her the competition.
meanings.sent2: His ungainliness on the balance beam was evident to everyone in the audience.
meanings.sent3: Despite his ungainliness, he managed to finish the race with a smile on his face.
meanings.sent4: The ungainliness of the newborn foal was a stark contrast to its graceful mother.
meanings.sent5: The ungainliness of the clown added to his comedic charm during the performance.
